facts.fact: The tallest mountain in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896. It lasted only 38 minutes.
The longest river in Asia is the Yangtze, which stretches for 3,915 miles.
The first recorded game of baseball was played in 1846 in Hoboken, New Jersey.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the observable universe.
The world's largest desert is the Sahara, which covers over 3.6 million square miles.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth, stretching over 1,400 miles.
The word 'queue' is the only word in the English language that is still pronounced the same way when the last four letters are removed.
The first successful flight by the Wright brothers lasted only 12 seconds and covered 120 feet.
